contents: Volcanoes form when magma, molten and semi-molten rock beneath the Earth’s surface, rises and _____(8)_____ a rupture in the crust. When a volcano erupts, it spews hot molten rock, ash, and gases. When this mixture reaches the Earth’s surface, _____(9)_____ called lava. When lava cools, it forms volcanic rock, including basalt and rhyolite. Complex factors such as the gases and minerals in the magma and the amount of built-up pressure affect how the volcano behaves.
